user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_TaskFindIdBySystemData:
```c
int32 OS_TaskFindIdBySystemData(osal_id_t *task_id, const void *sysdata, size_t sysdata_size)
{
    int32             return_code;
    OS_object_token_t token;

    /* Check parameters */
    OS_CHECK_POINTER(task_id);

    /* The "sysdata" and "sysdata_size" must be passed to the underlying impl for validation */
    return_code = OS_TaskValidateSystemData_Impl(sysdata, sysdata_size);
    if (return_code != OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return return_code;
    }

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetBySearch(OS_LOCK_MODE_GLOBAL, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, OS_TaskIdMatchSystemData_Impl,
                                         (void *)sysdata, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        *task_id = OS_ObjectIdFromToken(&token);

        OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The only code fragment that requires investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is the explicit cast that discards the const qualifier: (void *)sysdata. All other pointer uses in this function are either already const-qualified (const void *sysdata passed to OS_TaskValidateSystemData_Impl) or are output/object handles that must be non-const (osal_id_t *task_id and the subsequent assignment *task_id = ...). The OS_CHECK_POINTER(task_id) macro and the use of OS_ObjectIdFromToken/OS_ObjectIdRelease operate on non-const object tokens and are appropriate for mutable outputs. No other casts or non-const pointer-to-data usages are present in the shown code that would suggest additional violations of Rule 8.13.
